tool_description: Configures database authentication methods, multi-factor authentication, and credential validation policies for secure user access.

auth_method.description: Primary authentication method: password, ldap, kerberos, certificate, oauth2

password_policy.description: Password complexity requirements: basic, standard, strict

max_login_attempts.description: Maximum failed login attempts before lockout

error_messages: Invalid auth method: Use one of [password, ldap, kerberos, certificate, oauth2]
MFA methods required: When MFA is enabled, specify at least one MFA method
Invalid MFA method: Use valid MFA methods like totp, sms, email, hardware_token
Invalid password policy: Use one of [basic, standard, strict]
Invalid timeout: Session timeout must be between 5 and 1440 minutes
Invalid login attempts: Max login attempts must be between 3 and 20
usage: Specify auth_method as the primary authentication. Optionally enable MFA with mfa_methods, set password_policy, session_timeout, and max_login_attempts for security configuration.
